item.title: How Man Communicates Its Colors With Less On Os X
item.description: Today I was playing with the man utility and I discovered that it does not use the same strategy as ls for coloring its output. If we type: ls Colors will be displayed and the files will be listed in multiple columns, but if we send ls stdout to cat: ls | cat Colors will be removed and there will be one file per line. Why? Because when ls detects that its stdout is a tty, it outputs the list in multiple columns with colors.
